name: Aconitum Napellus
details:
A state of fear, anxiety; anguish of mind and body. Physical and mental restlessness, fright, is the most characteristic manifestation of Aconite. 
Acute, sudden and violent invesion, with fever, call for it.
Does not want to be touched. Sudden and great sinking of strength. Complaints and tension caused by exposure to dry, cold weather, draught of cold air, checked perspiration, also complaints from very hot weather, especially gastro-intestinal disturbances, etc.
First remedy in inflammations, inflammatory fevers. Serous membranes and muscular tissues affected markedly. Burning in internal parts; tingling, cold-ness and numbness. Influenza. Tension of arteries; emotional and physical mental tension explain many symptoms.
When prescribing Aconite, remember Aconite causes only functional disturbance, no evidence that it can produce tissue change; its action is brief and shows no periodicity. 
Its sphere is in the beginning of an acute disease and not to be continued after pathological change comes.
In Hyperaemia, congestion not after exudation has set in. 

Acids, wine and coffee, lemonade, and acid fruits modify its action. Most valuable antipyretic when with mental anguish and restlessness.
dosage: Sixth potency for sensory affections; First to third for congestive conditions. Must be repeated frequently in acute diseases. Acon. is a rapid worker. In Neuralgias tincture of the root often preferrable, one drop doses (poisonous), or again the 30th potency according to susceptibility of patient. Sulphur may be considered a chronic aconite. Often completes a cure begun with Aconite.

Mind: Music is unbearable; makes her sad.
Feels as if what had just been done was a dream.
Thinks his thoughs come from the stomach, that part of his body are abnormally thick.
Pains are intolerable; they drive him crazy.
Fears the future, a crowd, crossing the street.
Great fear, anxiety, and worry accompany every ailment, however trivial.
Fears death but believes that he will soon die; predicts the day.
Delirium is characterized by unhappiness, worry, fear, raving, rarely unconsciousness.
Head: Burning headache, as if brain were moved by boiling water.
Vertigo; worse on rising and shaking head.
Fullness; heavy, pulsating, hot, bursting, burning, undulating sensation.
Nocturnal furious delirium.
Intracranial pressure.
Sensation on vertex as if hair were pulled or stood on end.
Eyes: Profuse watering after exposure to dry, cold winds, reflection from snow, after extraction of cinders and other foreign bodies.
Feel dry and host, as if sand in them.
Ears: Sensation of drop of water in left ear.
External ear hot, red, painful, swollen.
Very sensitive to noises; music is unbearable.
Nose: Mucus membranes dry, nose stopped up; dry or with but scanty watery coryza.
Coryza; much sneezing; throbbing in nostrils.
Face: One cheek red, the other pale.
On rising, the red face becomes deathly pale, or he becomes dizzy.
Neuralgia, especially of left side, with restlessness, tingling, and numbness.
Mouth: Constantly moves lower jaw as if chewing.
Throat: Red, dry, constricted, numb, prickling, burning, stinging.
Stomach: Vomiting, with fear, heat, profuse sweat and increased urination.
Vomiting, billious, mucuous and bloody, greenish.
Drinks, vomits and declares he will die.
Bitter taste of everything except water.
Hematemeis, Burning from stomach to esophagus.
Abdomen: Abdominal symptoms better after warn soup.
Rectum: Frequent, small stool with tenesmus; green, like chopped herbs.
Choleraic discharge with collapse, anxiety, and restlessness.
Watery diarrhea in children; They cry and complain much, are sleepless and restless.
Pain with nightly itching and stitching in anus.
Urine: Anxiety always on beginning to urinate.
Profuse urination, with profuse perspiration and diarrhea.
Retention, with screaming and restlessness, and handling of genitals.
Tenesmus and burning at neck of bladder.
Male: Bruised pain in testicles, swollen, hard.
Female: After pains, with fear and restlessness.
Suppressed from fright, cold, in plethoric subjects.
Menses too profuse, with nosebleed, too protracted, late.
Respiratory: Hoarse, dry, croupy cough; loud, labored breathing.
Cough, dry, short, hacking; worse at night and after midnight.
Constant pressure in left chest; oppressed breathing on least motion.
Child grasps at throat every time he coughs.
Heart: Affections of the heart with pain in left shoulder.
Temporal and carotid arteries felt with sitting.
Palpitation, with anxiety, fainting, and tingling in fingers.
Pulse full, hard; tense and bounding; sometimes intermits.
Back: Crawling and tingling, as if bruised.
Extremeties: Bright red hypothenar eminences on both hands.
Rheumatic inflammation of joints; worst at night; red shining swelling, very sensitive.
Numbness and tingling; shooting pains; icy coldness and insensibility of hands and feet.
Sensation as if drops of water trickled down the thigh.
Weak and lax ligaments of all joints.
Arms feel lame, bruised, heavy, numb.
Knees unsteady; disposition of foot to turn.
Hip-joint and thigh feel lame, especially after lying down.
Sleep: Long dreams, with anxiety in chest.
Sleeplessness, with restless and tossing about.
Fever: Cold sweat and icy coldness of face.
Sweat drenching, on parts lain on; relieving all symptoms.
Evening chilliness soon after going to bed.
Modalities: Worse: in warm room, in evening and night.
Worse: Lying on affected side, from music, from tobacco smoke, dry, cold winds.
